intro: Neckia klossii, commonly known as the Kloss's neckia, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Seram in Indonesia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, Neckia klossii is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
